member.name: T:Json.Logic.JsonLogic
member.summary: Provides factory methods to create operations.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonLogic.LessThanOrEqual(Json.Logic.Rule,Json.Logic.Rule)
member.summary: Creates a `<=` ("less than or equal") rule.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonLogic.MoreThanOrEqual(Json.Logic.Rule,Json.Logic.Rule)
member.summary: Creates a `>=` ("more than or equal") rule.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonLogic.Literal(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)
member.summary: Creates a rule that stands in for a literal JSON value.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonLogic.Variable(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a `var` rule that accesses data.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonLogic.Variable(System.String,Json.Logic.Rule)
member.summary: Creates a `var` rule that accesses data.
member.param: A default value to use if the path is not found.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonLogic.Log(Json.Logic.Rule)
member.summary: Functions as a no-op. Processes the rule, then logs and returns the output.

member.name: T:Json.Logic.JsonLogicException
member.summary: Thrown when a rule cannot be processed or deserialized.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonLogicException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonNodeExtensions.IsTruthy(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)
member.summary: Determines whether a value can be considered as `true`.
member.returns:
`true` if the value is:
- a non-empty array - a non-empty string - a non-zero number - true
`false` otherwise

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonNodeExtensions.Stringify(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)
member.summary: Provides a loose-cast to a string.
member.returns:
A string representation of the value as follows:
- arrays are the elements stringified and comma-delimited - null returns the empty string - objects return null (not stringifiable) - numbers and booleans return their JSON equivalents - strings are unchanged

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonNodeExtensions.Numberify(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)
member.summary: Provides a loose-cast to a number.
member.returns:
A string representation of the value as follows:
- strings try to parse a number from the value - true returns 1 - false returns 0 - numbers are unchanged - null, objects, and arrays return null (not numberifiable)

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonNodeExtensions.Flatten(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)
member.summary: Flattens an array into its root components (removes intermediate arrays).
member.returns: Returns a single array with all of the intermediate arrays removed.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.JsonNodeExtensions.LooseEquals(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode,System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)
member.summary: Provides loose equality comparison of values.
member.returns: `true` if the values are loosely equal; `false` otherwise.

member.name: T:Json.Logic.OperatorAttribute
member.summary: Decorates implementations to identify a rule.

member.name: T:Json.Logic.Rule
member.summary: Provides a base class for rules.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.Rule.Apply(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode,System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)
member.summary: Applies the rule to the input data.
member.param: Optional secondary data. Used by a few operators to pass a secondary data context to inner operators.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.Rule.op_Implicit(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)~Json.Logic.Rule
member.summary: Casts a JSON value to a .

member.name: M:Json.Logic.Rule.op_Implicit(System.String)~Json.Logic.Rule
member.summary: Casts a `string` value to a . Can also be used to create a `null` JSON literal.

member.summary: Reads and converts the JSON to type .
member.param: An object that specifies serialization options to use.

member.summary: Writes a specified value as JSON.

An object that specifies serialization options to use.

member.name: T:Json.Logic.RuleRegistry
member.summary: Catalogs all of the known rules.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.RuleRegistry.GetRule(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a implementation for a given identifier string.

member.name: M:Json.Logic.RuleRegistry.AddRule``1
member.typeparam: The type of the rule to add.
member.remarks:
Rules must contain a parameterless constructor.
Decorate your rule type with one or more s to define its identifier.
Registering a rule with an identifier that already exists will overwrite the existing registration.
